mechanoreception.notes: As bivalves, Basterotiidae likely possess mechanoreceptors to detect physical stimuli and vibrations in their environment.

chemoreception.notes: Bivalves typically use chemoreception to detect chemical cues in the water, aiding in feeding and potentially mate recognition.

vision.notes: The presence or absence of visual capabilities in Basterotiidae is unknown based on the provided context. Many bivalves lack complex eyes, but some may have simple light-sensitive cells.
